bibl.title: Antony Hain v. King County. Final Judgement.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: Territory of Washington 3rd Judicial District SS
In District Court holding terms at Seattle in King County In the Matter of the Application of Anthony Han for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
div1.p: On this 5th day of October, A.D. 1878 comes the sheriff of said, King County, L.V. Wycroff, and produces the body of said Anthony Han and makes return of the Writ of Habeas Corpus heretofore issued herein And now the prisioner by his counsel, J.M. Hall, Esq, excepts to the sufficency of said return and moves for the remove of the prisioner from custody; pending the consideration whereof, the further hearing of this matter is affirmed, until Monday, the 9th day of October, 1878, at 10 o'clock in the forenoon.

And now on this 7th day of October, 1878, at the appointed hour, comes the said sheriff, and brings the body of the said Anthony Han as heretofore, and the further consideration of this matter is resumed.
And now after argument and being fully advised in the formises, it is now here considered and as judged that so much of the sentence of Samuel Greene
div1.ab: Friday, October 7th 1878 James Jerry Clerk W.H. Connahey Deputy J.M. Hall For Han
